# Battle of Lai

The Battle of La誰 began on 21 August 1914 in Chad, during the First World War at the village of La誰, capital of the district of Logone, on the Logone River in the south.
A German column from Kamerun, led by Captain Von Duhring, attacked the village of La誰, defended by Captain Jeanjean. After a bitter fight, the French were driven out and the village was occupied by the Germans until 1 September 1914.
